Post treatment of chloroform fraction and daturaolone ( 1) showed a significant (p < 0.001) antipyretic activity in febrile mice during different assessment times (1–5 h). The promising antihyperthermia activity (66.98% was recorded for chloroform fraction at 200 mg/kg i.p., while for daturaolone ( 1) was (78.98%) at 20 mg/kg i.p. after 3 h of sample administration (
